questions.question: What is the function of potassium iodide in this experiment?

answers.a: To act as a reducing agent
answers.c: To liberate iodine by reacting with chlorine

explanations.c: Potassium iodide reacts with chlorine (from bleaching powder) to liberate iodine, which is then titrated with sodium thiosulphate.

questions.question: Which of the following is the titration reaction between iodine and sodium thiosulphate?

explanations.a: Iodine reacts with sodium thiosulphate to produce sodium iodide and sodium tetrathionate. here
